instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Imac with MCP79MXD-B2
threads.message:
Have imac with MCP79MXD-B2
Has video problems. Worth to replace or there are not new chips?

threads.title: Imac with MCP79MXD-B2
threads.message: What video issues? I doubt the MCP will be to blame. Is this one of those 21.5" without the video card?

threads.title: Imac with MCP79MXD-B2
threads.message: Yes, i27 without video card. Will upload video later.

threads.title: Imac with MCP79MXD-B2
threads.message:
Wow, thank you. I was going to replace MCP
Bad panel or bad board on panel. I know some panel have boards and I can replace them.

threads.title: Imac with MCP79MXD-B2
threads.message: Also can a take a panel from 2008 model? My one is 2009 model.

threads.title: Imac with MCP79MXD-B2
threads.message:
Since when were 27" imacs made in 2008?

Als LM270WQ1 are the same 2009-2011. Only thing different is the SYNC cable for the inverter. You can swap the control board on the LCD or make up a new cable.
